Salmon Stir-Fry


Ingredients
1 pound salmon filet
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons sesame oil
1 red bell pepper, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 yellow bell pepper, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 onion, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 cup broccoli florets
1 tablespoon garlic
1 tablespoon ginger paste
2 tablespoons hoisin sauce
1/2 cup shredded carrots

Cooking Instructions

Heat a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Season
salmon with a sprinkle of salt and pepper. Cook salmon until
fish flakes easily with a fork, 3 to 5 minutes on each side.
Remove from skillet and set aside. Heat sesame oil in a wok
or heavy skillet over high heat. Add red pepper, yellow
pepper, onion, broccoli, garlic, and ginger paste, and cook
and stir for 3 minutes. Stir in hoisin sauce and toss well.
Add salmon, and flake it with a fork into chunks. Toss;
remove from heat. Add carrots and serve over rice.
Source 

https://www.allrecipes.com/salmon-stir-fry-recipe-7644799 

Reference Video 

https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=Salmon Stir-Fry
